name: KnorrSeq2
full_name: Knorr's notion of distance-based outlier adpated for sequences.
description: Each point or subsequence is assessed based on its distance to neighbors, specifically via its k-nearest neighbor distance, and ranked accordingly. Those with the largest such distances are flagged as outliers.
bibtex: @inproceedings{10.1007/11604655_61,author = {Palshikar, Girish Keshav},title = {Distance-Based outliers in sequences},year = {2005},isbn = {3540309993},publisher = {Springer-Verlag},address = {Berlin, Heidelberg},doi = {10.1007/11604655_61},booktitle = {Proceedings of the Second International Conference on Distributed Computing and Internet Technology},pages = {547â€“552},numpages = {6},location = {Bhubaneswar, India},series = {ICDCIT'05}}
